name: Steel String Acoustic Guitar
description: A mid to high register plucked string instrument with steel strings

name: Classical Guitar
description: A mid to high register plucked string instrument with nylon strings

name: Flamenco Guitar
description: A mid to high register plucked string instrument with nylon strings

name: Electric Bass Guitar
description: A low register plucked string instrument

name: Drum Kit
description: A collection of percussion instruments operated by a single player

name: Clean Tenor Male Vocals
description: A Male singing cleanly in the highest tradiitonal male vocal register

name: Clean Tenor Female Vocals
description: A Female singing cleanly in the highest tradiitonal male vocal register

name: Clean Tenor Vocals
description: A Male or Female singing cleanly

name: Throat Singing
description: Also known as Overtone Singing, a style used in many traditional cultures

name: Piano
description: An acoustic keyboard instrument

name: Drum Machine
description: An electronic instrument used to create artificial percussion

name: Theremin
description: An electronic instrument controlled without physical touch, producing an eerie, electronic, glissando sound

name: Sample
description: A reused portion of an already existing recording, used musically, such as with a song sample; or for thematic effect, such as with a movie sample

name: Turn Table
description: A record player modified by DJs to use as a musical instrument

name: Continuum Fingerboard
description: A type of electronic synthesizer that uses a soft keyboard to allow the user to use portamento and vibrato while playing

name: Caj√≥n Drum
description: A box drum played by slapping the front or rear face

name: Violin
description: A high pitched wooden string instrument, also known as a fiddle

name: Violin Section
description: A section of high pitched wooden string instruments, also known as a fiddles

name: Viola
description: A mid ranged wooden string instrument

name: Viola Section
description: A section of mid ranged wooden string instruments

name: Cello
description: A mid to low ranged wooden string instrument

name: Cello Section
description: A section of mid to low ranged wooden string instruments

name: Double Bass
description: A low ranged wooden string instrument, AKA Upright Bass

name: Double Bass Section
description: A section of low ranged wooden string instruments

name: String Section
description: A section of instruments usually consisting of first and second violins, violas, cellos, and double basses

name: Synth Guitar
description: A guitar-like synth controller

name: Acoustic Bass Guitar
description: A hollow body low register acoustic instrument

name: Harp
description: A stringed musical instrument that has a number of individual strings running at an angle to its soundboard

name: Lute
description: A high pitched, stringed musical instrument that can have a varied amount of courses

name: Oud
description: A fretless, high pitched, stringed musical instrument in the lute family that can have a varied amount of courses

name: Baroque Guitar
description: A 5 course, stringed musical instrument commonplace during the renaissance

name: Theorbo
description: A lute instrument with an incredibly large range

name: Hollow Body Electric Guitar
description: A type of guitar with both a soundbox and electric pickups

name: Pipe Organ
description: An instrument that produces sound by pushing air through pipes, selected by a keyboard

name: Celesta
description: An keyboard instrument with a "celestial" sound, created by hammers striking metal plates

name: Harpsichord
description: An keyboard instrument that generates sound by using a keyboard to pluck strings

name: Hurdy Gurdy
description: An instrument that generates sound by a hand cranked wheel rubbing against the strings, with the melody operated by a keyboard

name: Harmonica
description: An small wind instrument played by using the mouth to direct air into the reed

name: Flute
description: A high pitched wind instrument. Also, one of the oldest human instruments.

name: Flute Section
description: A section of high pitched wind instruments

name: Piccolo
description: A half sized flute that plays an octave higher

name: Pan Flute
description: An instrument consisting of multiple flute pipes tuned to different notes

name: Ocarina
description: An enclosed space with several finger holes to create different notes, typically clay or ceramic

name: Bagpipes
description: A wind instrument which uses a constant reservoir of air in a bag to feed reeds and create sound

name: Oboe
description: A mid ranged wind instrument

name: Oboe Section
description: A section of mid ranged wind instruments

name: English Horn
description: Also known as the Cor anglais, an english horn is a wind instrument that is similar to the oboe, but has a deeper sound

name: Bass Oboe
description: An oboe that sounds an octave lower

name: Clarinet
description: A mid ranged wind instrument

name: Clarinet Section
description: A section of mid ranged wind instruments

name: Basset Horn
description: A wind instrument similar to the clarinet, but with a slightly lower range and altered timbre

name: Bassoon
description: A lower ranged wind instrument

name: Bassoon Section
description: A section of lower ranged wind instrument

name: Mellotron
description: A keyboard instrument that uses magnetic tape to create it's sound

name: Rhodes Piano
description: A keyboard instrument that strikes metal tines to create it's sound

name: Electric Organ
description: Also known as a Hammond Organ, uses spinning magnets called 'tonewheels' to create sound

name: Clavichord
description: A keyboard instrument that produces a soft sound by using metal blades to hammer the strings

name: Harmonium
description: Also known as a pump organ, it's a keyboard instrument that produces a soft sound by using metal blades to hammer the strings

name: Keyboard Glockenspiel
description: Also known as a pump organ, it's a keyboard instrument that produces a soft sound by using metal blades to hammer the strings

name: Regal
description: A keyboard instrument that produces sound with brass reeds

name: Accordion
description: A unique keyboard instrument that produces sound by opening and closing valves using a keyboard and buttons while pumping a bellows

name: wind Section
description: A section of instruments usually consisting of flutes, oboes, bassoons, clarinets and occasionally some auxlillary instruments

name: Alto Saxophone
description: An instrument that despite being made of brass, is a wind instrument due to it's reed

name: Tenor Saxophone
description: An instrument that despite being made of brass, is a wind instrument due to it's reed

name: Baritone Saxophone
description: An instrument that despite being made of brass, is a wind instrument due to it's reed

name: Male Choir
description: A choir of males singing

name: Female Choir
description: A choir of females singing

name: Childrens Choir
description: A choir of children singing

name: Child Vocals
description: A children singing

name: Mixed Choir
description: A choir of both males and females singing

name: Mark Tree
description: Also known as Bar Chimes, a length of chimes hanging from a bar, used to create musical color

name: Timpani
description: Also known as Kettle Drums, they are sets of pitched drums

name: Musical Saw
description: A hand saw, used as a musical instrument with a bow, capable of creating ethereal sounds

name: Snare Drum
description: A drum that produces a sharp staccato sound due to the wires attached to the bottom of the bottom drum head

name: Tenor Drum
description: A mid pitched percussion instrument

name: Bass Drum
description: A low pitched percussion instrument

name: Cymbals
description: A metal disk that can produce a wide variety of tones with indefinite pitch

name: Distorted Choir
description: A choir of screamed and growled vocals

name: Distorted Vocals
description: Screamed/growled vocals

name: French Horn
description: Or just known as 'the horn', a high pitched brass instrument

name: French Horn Section
description: Or just known as 'the horn section', a section of high pitched brass instruments

name: Trumpet
description: A high pitched brass instrument

name: Trumpet Section
description: A section of high pitched brass instruments

name: Cornet
description: A high pitched brass instrument similar to a trumpet, but with a more mellow tonal quality

name: Trombone
description: A mid to low range brass instrument

name: Trombone Section
description: A section of mid to low range brass instruments

name: Euphonium
description: A mid to low range brass instrument

name: Tuba
description: A low range brass instrument

name: Tuba Section
description: A section of low range brass instruments

name: Bass Trombone
description: A trombone that plays at a slightly lower range

name: Brass Section
description: A section of brass instruments usually consisting of trumpets, horns, trombones, and tubas

name: Triangle
description: A metal triangle that can create a high pitch pangy sound

name: Tam-Tam
description: A type of gong that has an indefinite pitch, the type most familar to those in the west

name: Tambourine
description: A small drum with small metal jingles attached to it

name: Wood Block
description: A block of wood that is struck to create a percussive sound

name: Glockenspiel
description: A set of pitched metal plates that are struck to create melodic percussion

name: Xylophone
description: A set of pitched wood plates that are struck to create melodic percussion

name: Vibraphone
description: A set of pitched metal plates that are struck to create melodic percussion, similar to a glockenspiel, but resonates through metal tubes

name: Marimba
description: A set of pitched wood plates that are struck to create melodic percussion, similar to a xylophone, but resonates through metal tubes

name: Crotales
description: Very bright, high pitched cymbals, sometimes referred to as antique cymbals

name: Tubular Bells
description: Tubes of metal that were made to recreate the sound of church bells for an ensemble

name: Flexatone
description: Two beaters that hit a flexible piece of metal, producing a glissando effect similar to a singing saw

name: Waterphone
description: A very unique percussion instrument that uses a resonator with a small amount of water in it and uses small metal rods around the rim of the bowl to create sound

name: Bell Tree
description: A set of vertically nested bells that can be struck individually or used for a glissando effect

name: Kalimba
description: Also known as a Mbira, a wooden board or box with staggered metal tines to be plucked

name: Body Percussion
description: Snapping, Clapping, Stomping, Hamboning, Patting and however you can make percussion with your body

name: Egg Shaker
description: A container full of loose objects that when shaken produces a swishy percussive noise

name: Maracas
description: A type of rattle/shaker with a wood or gourd body containing beads or pebbles

name: Banjo
description: A plucked string instrument with a membrane resonation chamber

name: Mandolin
description: A plucked string instrument with four courses tuned in perfect fifths

name: Ukelele
description: A high pitched plucked string instrument with four nylon strings

name: Sitar
description: A plucked string instrument typically played with a drone string and typially has many strings

name: Zither
description: A plucked string instrument with many strings stretched along a thin, flat body

name: Bass Clarinet
description: A lower pitched variant of the Clarinet

name: Contrabass Clarinet
description: A very low pitched variant of the Clarinet

name: Contrabassoon
description: A low pitched variant of the Bassoon

name: Carillon
description: A tower of bells operated usually by a keyboard

name: Fife
description: A small transverse wind instrument

name: Alphorn
description: Also known as the Alpenhorn, a several meter long wooden horn

name: Cornett
description: Also known as the cornetto, an early wind instrument

name: Crumhorn
description: An early wind instrument with a unique timbre

name: Tin Whistle
description: Also known as a penny whistle, a simple wind instrument with a high pitch sound

name: Sheng
description: A traditional polyphonic chinese wind instrument

name: Lyre
description: A very old instrument, similar to a small harp, but plucked with a plectrum

name: Resonator Guitar
description: AKA a Dobro, an acoustic guitar that produces sound by conducting vibrations into metal cones instead of the guitars soundboard, typically played slide but not exclusively

name: Pedal Steel Guitar
description: A steel guitar that is layed horizontal and has many pedals and levers. It is capable of unlimited glissandi and can sometimes sound like a human voice.

name: Hammered Dulcimer
description: A unique instrument that gets its beautiful sound from strings stretched over a trapezoidal soundboard and played with a mallet

name: Appalacian Dulcimer
description: A folk instrument related to the zither, but with typically only 3 or 4 strings, with the body extending the length of the fingerboard.

name: 12 String Guitar
description: An electric or acoustic guitar with each of its 6 strings replaced with a 2 string course, making each string produce 2 notes an octave apart

name: Clean Electric Guitar
description: An electric guitar with a clean tone

name: Overdriven Electric Guitar
description: An electric guitar with a slightly dirty overdriven tone

name: Distorted Electric Guitar
description: An electric guitar with a very crunchy and distorted tone

name: Fuzz Electric Guitar
description: An electric guitar with a fuzzy tone

name: 7 String Electric Guitar
description: An electric guitar with 7 strings, typically played with a distorted tone, but not exclusively

name: 8 String Electric Guitar
description: An electric guitar with 8 strings, typically played with a distorted tone, but not exclusively

name: 9 String Electric Guitar
description: An electric guitar with 9 strings, typically played with a distorted tone, but not exclusively

name: Otamatone
description: A very unique instrument that is played with one hand on the touchpad which effects pitch and one hand to control the "mouth" of the instrument to control timbre

name: Omnichord
description: An electronic instrument that uses buttons to pick out chord types and a touch plate for simulating strumming

name: Stylophone
description: An stylus operated synthesizer instrument

name: Guqin
description: A chinese plucked string instrument that has been used since ancient times

name: Synth Pad
description: A synthesizer tone with a long attack and release and high sustain, often emulating the sound of a bowed instrument or choir.

name: Synth Lead
description: A synthesizer tone that is usually monophonic with a bold and harmonically rich sound with high sustain to cut through a mix

name: Synth Bell
description: A synthesizer tone with quick attack and decay with long, low release and very harmonically rich. Usually created with FM synthesis.

name: Synth Keys
description: A synthesizer tone emulating the sound of pianos and organs, always polyphonic. Usually simple wave forms.

name: Synth Plucks
description: A synthesizer tone with quick attack, decay and release, emulating the sound of a pizz strings. Like bells, but harmonically simpler and shorter release.

name: Synth Brass
description: A synthesizer tone with slightly slower attack and quick release, harmonically rich and spanning a fairly wide frequency range. FM synths often work well for this too.

name: Synth Bass
description: A synthesizer tone, usually monophonic, usually built with a simple waveform to ensure a strong fundamental frequency.

name: Synth Stab
description: A synthesizer tone that is basically a short attack-short release version of Synth Brass. Think the big synths chords on Thriller.

name: Rapping
description: Spoken or chanted rhyming lyrics. The components of rap include lyrics, "flow" (rhythm, rhyme), and "delivery" (cadence, tone).

name: Mellophone
description: Mid ranged brass instrument, sometimes used in place of french horns

name: Percussion Section
description: A section of instruments consisting of timpani as well as various pitched and unpitched percussion

name: Chiptune Pulse Wave
description: A synthesizer tone made up of just a simple pulse wave. It's called a square wave if it has a 50% duty cycle

name: Chiptune Triangle Wave
description: A synthesizer tone made up of just a simple triangle wave. Typical of bass lines.

name: Chiptune Saw Wave
description: A synthesizer tone made up of just a simple saw wave.

name: Chiptune Sine Wave
description: A synthesizer tone made up of just a simple sine wave.

name: Orchestral Hit
description: AKA Orchestral Stab, is a synth sound made by layering different orchestral instruments playing a single staccato note/chord.
